'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': "<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->\n<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->\n<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->\n\n<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->\n**Description**: It would be highly beneficial to have the ability to create and manage multiple collections of watch values in the Watch panel of the Visual Studio Code debugger. This feature would allow developers to organize and group related watch expressions, making it easier to debug complex applications.\n\n**Use Case:** When debugging large applications, developers often need to monitor a variety of variables and expressions. Currently, all watch expressions are listed in a single, flat list, which can become cluttered and difficult to manage. By allowing multiple collections or groups of watch values, developers can better organize their watch expressions based on different contexts or modules within their application.\n\n**Proposed Solution**:\n\nAdd functionality to create, rename, and delete collections of watch values.\nAllow users to add watch expressions to specific collections.\nProvide a UI in the Watch panel to switch between different collections.\n**Example:**\n\nCollection 1: Physics Variables\nPhysic.VelocityX\nPhysic.VelocityY\nCollection 2: Player State\nPlayer.Health\nPlayer.Position\nBenefits:\n\nImproved organization of watch expressions.\nEasier navigation and management of variables during debugging.\nEnhanced productivity for developers working on large and complex projects.\nAdditional Context: This feature would be particularly useful for developers working on games, simulations, or any application with multiple subsystems that need to be debugged simultaneously.\n\n\n", 'closed_by': None, Open a terminal.\r\n2. Click on the terminal name button.\r\n3. Choose "Change color..." and select any color in the modal.\r\n4. Click on the terminal name button again.\r\n5. Try "Rename...", "Split terminal", or "Kill terminal."\r\n6. Notice the buttons don\'t work.\r\n\r\n## Issue\r\nThe problem happens when you pick a color from the modal. When the color is selected, the modal briefly grabs focus, which triggers an `onDidFocus` event. This event updates `_lastFocusedWidget` in `listService`, which is then mistakenly used in the function `getSelectedInstances`. The function assumes that `lastFocusedList` is always a `TerminalTabList`, which isn\'t always true.\r\n\r\n## Fix  \r\nThe fix ensures `listService.lastFocusedList` is only used when it\'s a `TerminalTabList`, not when other widgets like the `QuickInputTree` are focused.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\nLet me know if any adjustments are needed!\r\n', 'closed_by': None, 'reactions': {'url': Please let me know if you need further details.\n\nSteps to Reproduce:\n\n1. Install remote ssh extension and other extensions from microsoft or github publisher \n2. Add the following entry to the group policy for allowed extensions `{ "github": true, "microsoft": true }`\n3.  Now the remote ssh editing icon disappears from the side bar, see image below, basically the publisher field is not working as expected\n\n     ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/24dfde49-c95f-4a72-97b8-50b5b3cd2401)\n4. Add the extensions with the correct extension id to the group policy, then apply with `gpupdate` , the extensions are enabled again\n5. Use a  a very long list of allowed extensions like in the example below, the group policy field cuts off after a specific length and the resulting entry is invalid and as such is ignored by the group policy\n```json\n{\n"ASF.apache-netbeans-java": true,\n"asciidoctor.asciidoctor-vscode": true,\n"baincd.copy-path-unixstyle": true,\n"charliermarsh.ruff": true,\n"eamodio.gitlens": true,\n"github": true,\n"microsoft": true,\n"ms-azuretools.vscode-docker": true,\n"ms-python.debugpy": true,\n"ms-python.python": true,\n"ms-python.vscode-pylance": true,\n"ms-toolsai.datawrangler": true,\n"ms-vscode.remote-explorer": true,\n"redhat": "stable",\n"redhat.ansible": true,\n"redhat.java": true,\n"redhat.vscode-yaml": true,\n"visualstudioexptteam.intellicode-api-usage-examples": true,\n"visualstudioexptteam.vscodeintellicode": true,\n"vscjava.vscode-gradle": true,\n"vscjava.vscode-java-debug": true,\n"vscjava.vscode-java-dependency": true,\n"vscjava.vscode-java-pack": true,\n"vscjava.vscode-java-test": true,\n"vscjava.vscode-maven": true\n}\n```\n  \n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ec6734d7-9ae5-4e00-8e8a-2fb2e2cc6816)\n', 'closed_by': None, 'updated_at': '2025-01-24T23:05:29Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'NONE', 'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0}, 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': "<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->\n<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->\n<!-- ðŸ•® Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->\n<!-- ðŸ”Ž Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->\n<!-- ðŸ§ª Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->\n<!-- ðŸ’¡ Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->\n<!-- ðŸ”§ Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->\nDoes this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No\nYes\n<!-- ðŸª“ If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->\n<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->\n- VS Code Version: 1.96.4\n- OS Version: Windows 11\n\nSteps to Reproduce:\n1. Make a code change in a reasonably long file, in a language that has inlay hints, so there's a diff\n2. Open the diff viewer, ensure word wrap is enabled (<kbd>Alt</kbd><kbd>Z</kbd>), and scroll around throughout the file\n3. Watch as the lines get misaligned between the added and removed side\n4. Use <kbd>Ctrl</kbd><kbd>Alt</kbd> (with `editor.inlayHints.enabled` set to `onUnlessPressed`) to temporarily hide the inlays and notice how they also get misaligned\n\nVideo of the bug in action:\n\n[Video (70 seconds)](https://files.keavon.com/-/HarshAcclaimedEuropeanfiresalamander/capture_40_.mp4), showing both the scrolling-caused misalignment and triggering it with toggling inlays.\n\nDescription:\n\nThis is an issue that has frustrated my many times a day for years, so I'm finally filling an issue for it.\n\nThe diff editor is meant to keep your left (removals) and right (additions) side's lines aligned. But scrolling throughout the code file, or turning on/off inlay hints, causes a misalignment to occur and persist. The result is that the red removals and green additions for a line can be considerably misaligned.\n\nThis happens under the conditions that word wrap is enabled (so a line of code may wrap across multiple displayed lines on the left, right, or both sides) and inlays are enabled (so the width of a line of code may become elongated).\n\nMy theory is that scrolling within the document causes the LSP to generate more inlays within the newly viewed areas, changing the line widths which changes the wrapping which changes the number of wrapped lines occupied by one line of code; and it does so differently on the right from the left, since the LSP generates no inlays for the left side.\n\nThe workaround for this is to either type something to make it recalculate, or briefly toggle word wrap by tapping <kbd>Alt</kbd><kbd>Z</kbd> twice. But a proper fix for this bug would be a real quality of life improvement.", 'closed_by': None, 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238724/reactions', No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->\n<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->\n- VS Code Version: 1.96.2\n- OS Version: Nixos 25.05 unstable\n\nSteps to Reproduce:\n\n1. have `editor.scrollBeyondLastLine` enabled\n2. in an edit window, scroll so that the bottom of the text aligns with the bottom of the editor pane\n\nWhat was expected:\n3. the scrollbar position should now be at the bottom, and scrollbar indicators/minimap etc should all be stretched so that 100% of the scrollbar means 100% of the document position\n\nWhat actually happens:\n3. The scrollbar, indicators etc are not at 100%. For short documents, this is even only at 50%. The scrobbler remains the same size when scrolling past the last line\n\nIMHO the correct behavior when scrolling past the last line is that the scrobbler shrinks so that the top of the scrobbler indicates the position of the first line in the editor, and the bottom is at 100% of the scrollbar.\n\nThe way it should look:\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c3fc84bc-6980-437b-84ac-3c79450149cc)\n\nThe way it looks However, these are in two different "personas", which need two different names/email addresses.  Currently, I\'ve set up profiles in VSCode to reflect this, but I haven\'t found a way to change the settings in git to reflect this.\n\n - It _can_ be manually configured for each repository via `git config user.email ....`.  Unfortunately, these are all in devcontainers, so not only does it have to be done for each one, but it has to be re-done each time the container is rebuilt.\n - There are ways to conditionally configure git... unfortunately this has to be handled through separate config files, which the devcontainer extension doesn\'t copy (although I\'ve submitted an issue with them)\n - It can be configured with environment variables; `GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL`/`GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL`/etc.  Unfortunately, the only way I\'ve found to do this per-profile so far is the `terminal.integrated.env.<os>`/`terminal.integrated.profiles.<os>.<shell>.env` settings, which the built-in git extension (of course?) ignores.\n   - Currently if I try to use this it means that commits between the UI and the CLI have mismatching authors/emails!  Fun times.\n   - Setting this as an environment variable on the devcontainer isn\'t an option, for obvious reasons. \n\nSo, I\'d prefer some way to be able to set this per-profile to support working Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->\n<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->\n- VS Code Version: 1.96.4\n- OS Version: Debian sid\n\nSteps to Reproduce:\n\nVS Code's APT sources.list has two problems. Now it is:\n\n```sh\n~> cat /etc/apt/sources.list.d/vscode.list\n### THIS FILE IS AUTOMATICALLY CONFIGURED ###\n# You may comment out this entry, but any other modifications may be lost.\ndeb [arch=amd64,arm64,armhf] https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/code stable main\n```\n\n### Problem 1: Missing `signed-by` field\n\nThe recent [APT 2.9.24 update](https://mastodon.social/@juliank/113866133456641922) introduced a [change](https://salsa.debian.org/apt-team/apt/-/commit/61f8f40f921cde13c5b97abbdf900646745e8e30#b3f55b8d9783f2ed27acfd1f0fe06dfc461e2aba_1_6):\n\n> /etc/apt/trusted.gpg is no longer used as a source of signers.  \n> Sources without Signed-By are fully deprecated, and therefore /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d is deprecated.\n\nThis has led to warnings when running `apt update`, such as:\n\n```\nNotice: Missing Signed-By in the sources.list(5) entry for 'https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/edge'\nNotice: Missing Signed-By in the sources.list(5) entry for 'https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/code'\nNotice: Consider migrating all sources.list(5) entries to the deb822 .sources format\nNotice: The deb822 .sources format supports both embedded as well as external OpenPGP keys\nNotice: See apt-secure(7) for best practices in configuring repository signing.\n```\n\n---\n\n### Problem 2: Unnecessary architectures\n\nThe current configuration includes three architectures: `amd64`, `arm64`, and `armhf`. This results in downloading unnecessary index files for architectures that are not in use, wasting bandwidth and server resources. Should these be removed?\n\n---\n\n### Solution\n\nAccording to the [Debian Wiki](https://wiki.debian.org/DebianRepository/UseThirdParty), the `microsoft.gpg` key should be moved from `/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d` to `/usr/share/keyrings`, and then you can choose one of the following two solutions:\n\n1. Update `/etc/apt/sources.list.d/vscode.list` to the following:\n```\ndeb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/microsoft.gpg] https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/code stable main\n```\n\n2. Completely remove `/etc/apt/sources.list.d/vscode.list` and switch to the DEB822 format. For more information on the DEB822 format, refer to `source.list(5)`. The DEB822 format also allows embedding the public key within the source list file.", 'closed_by': None, 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238697/reactions', disabled?: Yes\n\n- VS Code Version: 1.96.4\n- OS Version: macOS Sequoia 15.2\n\nSteps to Reproduce:\n1. Open a Python file containing multiple occurrences of \'is None\' both nested within functions/methods and at the module level\n2. Create two versions of the file - one with an extra line break at the end, one without\n3. Use regex search pattern `is None` on both files\n4. Observe that with line break:\n   - Nested \'is None\' occurrences are found\n   - Non-nested occurrences are not found\n5. Observe that without line break:\n   - All \'is None\' occurrences are found correctly\n\nExample test_cases:\n```\n# Test cases\ntest_cases = [\n    \'query.filter(User.active is True)\',\n    \'query.filter(User.deleted is not None)\',\n    \'filter(Post.draft is False)\',\n    \'filter(Comment.parent_id is None)\',\n    \'filter(or_(User.type != "global", User.type is None))\',\n    \'\'\'.filter(\n            or_(\n                Intrance_upload.trainings_type != "global",\n                Intrance_upload.trainings_type is None,\n            )\n        )\'\'\',\n    # Non-matching cases\n    \'filter(User.name == "test")\',\n    \'filter(Post.id != None)\',\n]\n```\n\nRegex used:\n`filter\\([^)]*?\\bis\\s+(?:not\\s+)?(?:None|True|False)\\b[^)]*?\\)`\n\nExpected behavior:\n- Regex search should find all occurrences of \'is None\' consistently, regardless of trailing line breaks\n\nActual behavior:\n- Search behavior differs based on presence of trailing line break\n- With trailing line break: only finds nested occurrences \n- Without trailing line break: finds all occurrences\n\nAdditional Information:\n- Issue appears to be specific to regex search functionality\n\nhttps://github.com/user-attachments/assets/66d4b699-b8cd-48e0-82dd-7feea071eb76\n\n- Behavior is reproducible with standard Python syntax\n- Video demonstration attached shows the "<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->\n<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->\n<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->\n\n<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->\nI am building an extension with a walkthrough and a command. What I want to achieve is that:\n- When user trigger the command, show the walkthrough first, highly encouraging them to finish reading all steps.\n- And if the user has marked the walkthrough done, the walkthrough won't be shown automatically when the command is triggered next time. \n\nI asked https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-discussions/discussions/2494 here before and seems like there isn't any direct way to know whether the completion is done. Even though I could add a command in each step marking the step done, things will get messed up when user choose to manually check off or reset the walkthrough state. For example, user first clicks the button in the step, so extension track a state to be done. And then user uncheck the step or reset the walkthrough state, there seems to be no way to track such event.\n\nTherefore, It would be helpful if the walkthrough completion state can be exposed that 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0}, 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': "Similar Issues:\n#233193\n#235479\n\nA `#XXXXXX` annotation does not always mean an html color, as obviously `#` just means number or id in natural languages, and in programming it can refer to an issue id or line number.\n\nWhen not in an web development context, displaying such inline color pickers can be quite annoying - not only because it shows a color block, but also because it makes cursor/selection unintuitive. But it can be still helpful when a user happens to need to hack on some web stuff.\n\nSo we need a feature to **enable/disable it depends on context, an easy way to guess the context is file type**. For example:\n\n- html/css/php, you may always want this feature.\n- js: **_likely_** web development but maybe not interested in colors, and also there're node.js context which is not web development.\n- csharp/python/java/go: they **can** be used in web development\n- c/c++/...: unlikely but possible\n- scm/changelogs: no matter whether it's web development, a `#XXXXXX` likely does not mean an html color here.\n\nIt's kind of complex to design a more intelligent way to guess the probability of _whether a `#XXXXXX` means an html color_, but at least one thing that satisfies user needs more is:\n**Disable** Inline Color Picker **globally** and enable it on html/css/php/... file types (and let user add the file types).", 'closed_by': None, 'reactions': {'url': Ours has units of font size, while the editor's is in pixels.\r\n\r\nThe explanation for this line:\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/4765f5c9f608c32b013e60a4bce5d4f8e31a5ee9/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminalContrib/suggest/browser/terminalSuggestAddon.ts#L404\r\n\r\nCodicons have a min size of 16px, so if this is less than that, they'll get cutoff. Our default terminal value for font, 12px, and line height, 1px, mean that the icon will be cutoff by default without the use of a multiplier like 1.5.\r\n\r\nYou can also see this happens for the editor with a small font size. But this jump list can be really confusing.  For example I often have cross platform solutions that build on windows and linux.  I have it checked out to the same Dev Drive (the windows dev drive feature) and that same dev drive is available in WSL2 under /mnt/driveHere.\n\nSo I will work on the same git code in two separate visual studio code instances (one opened directly on windows off the dev drive) and the other opened from WSL2 Extension directly off the same dev drive and same code files.\n\nHowever the jump list will show "foldernamehere" for both of them, so if the folder is called "vise" I will just see two "vise" entries, one from windows and one from wsl2.  I have to hover over them to see if its "vscode-remote/..ubuntu..." etc to know it\'s in wsl2.\n\nWhat I would prefer is if in the "settings.json" in the ".vscode" folder I can put an expression to control the title of jump list entries.  So I could make it do "${workspaceFolder} - ${envName}" or something like that. \n\nBut I would settle for icons "foldernamehere - windows icon" or "foldernamehere - wsl2 icon" etc.\n\nBut this problem also occurs with git worktrees.  If I have the same project checked out in 5 different git worktrees each on a different branch, they all show up in jump list as "projectfolderhere". So i.e I might see 5 "Thing.WebSite" entries...\n\nSo the ability to use expressions in vscode settings would be nice and if I could have expressions for git like "${rootWorkspaceFolder} - ${envName} | ${gitBranchName}"\n\nI really enjoy the windows 11 taskbar, pinning things, and the jump lists, it\'s really handy and time saving for opening things, but it would be a lot better if I could put more details in the jump lists.\n\nThis could be a windows limitation that isn\'t controllable by VSCode, but thought I\'d inquire.\n\nLooking into the windows api a little I think this would involve 'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0}, 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'I had a bug raised against Dart where the debugger shows threads as "paused on entry" when they should not be. The DAP traffic looks good:\n\n```\n// Start\n[5:17:21 PM] [DAP] [Info] <== {"seq":21,"type":"event","body":{"reason":"started","threadId":3},"event":"thread"}\n// Pause\n[5:17:21 PM] [DAP] [Info] <== {"seq":43,"type":"event","body":{"allThreadsStopped":false,"reason":"entry","threadId":3},"event":"stopped"}\n// Resume\n[5:17:21 PM] [DAP] [Info] <== {"seq":78,"type":"event","body":{"allThreadsContinued":false,"threadId":3},"event":"continued"}\n```\n\nYet the UI shows the thread as paused. I was able to reproduce this in MockDebug. It seems to only occur when the events occur close together (if I add delays, it doesn\'t seem to happen):\n\n```ts\n// Start additional threads, pause on entry, continue.\nfor (var i = 2; i < 5; i++) {\n\tthis._threads.push(new Thread(i, `Thread ${i}`));\n\tthis.sendEvent(new ThreadEvent(\'started\', i));\n\tthis.sendEvent(new OutputEvent(`Thread ${i} started\\n`));\n\tthis.sendEvent(new StoppedEvent(\'entry\', i));\n\tthis.sendEvent(new OutputEvent(`Thread ${i} stopped on entry\\n`));\n\t// await this.delay(1); // Uncomment this to fix it\n\tthis.sendEvent(new ContinuedEvent(i, false));\n\tthis.sendEvent(new OutputEvent(`Thread ${i} continued\\n`));\n}\n```\n\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0fb97a17-fbeb-4507-b414-34ed1f3311c1)\n\nFull repro is here:\n\nhttps://github.com/DanTup/vscode-mock-debug/tree/repro-dart-code-5397 / https://github.com/DanTup/vscode-mock-debug/commit/04f4764e853cbee2b09ca28c110c423fb4b99fd0\n\nThis felt a bit like https://github.com/microsoft/debug-adapter-protocol/issues/513 to me, but that actually turned out to be caused by `allThreadsStopped` defaulting to `true`. I don\'t believe that\'s the case here because in the real project where this happens (Dart debugger), we set both `allThreadsStopped` and `allThreadsContinued` to `false` (though I haven\'t set `allThreadsContinued` in the MockDebug example because it doesn\'t seem to be available in the constructor... I don\'t believe that\'s the issue though as `allThreadsContinued` seems to default to false and the delay shouldn\'t fix the issue in that case).', 'closed_by': None, 'reactions': {'url': For example here\'s a piece of `PostgreSQL` code:\n<details>\n  <summary>Wall of C code</summary>\n\n```C\nRelFileNumber\nGetNewRelFileNumber(Oid reltablespace, Relation pg_class, char relpersistence)\n{\n\tRelFileLocatorBackend rlocator;\n\tchar\t   *rpath;\n\tbool\t\tcollides;\n\tProcNumber\tprocNumber;\n\n\t/*\n\t * If we ever get here during pg_upgrade, there\'s something wrong; all\n\t * relfilenumber assignments during a binary-upgrade run should be\n\t * determined by commands in the dump script.\n\t */\n\tAssert(!IsBinaryUpgrade);\n\n\tswitch (relpersistence)\n\t{\n\t\tcase RELPERSISTENCE_TEMP:\n\t\t\tprocNumber = ProcNumberForTempRelations();\n\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\tcase RELPERSISTENCE_UNLOGGED:\n\t\tcase RELPERSISTENCE_PERMANENT:\n\t\t\tprocNumber = INVALID_PROC_NUMBER;\n\t\t\tbreak;\n\t\tdefault:\n\t\t\telog(ERROR, "invalid relpersistence: %c", relpersistence);\n\t\t\treturn InvalidRelFileNumber;\t/* placate compiler */\n\t}\n....\n}\n```\n</details>\n\nThe StickyScroll makes reading this kind of code really nice, but sometimes there are extremely long `if` statements and having those Stick is really nice. However the `outlineModel` doesn\'t really care about the `if` statements. The next best alternative would be the `foldingProviderModel`, but that doesn\'t work well with this coding convention. The Sticky looks like this:\n\n```C\n{\n    {\n        {\n             /* some code here */\n...\n```\n\nAnd surely if one were to fold the opening braces to the same line, it\'d look way more useful:\n```C\nGetNewRelFileNumber(Oid reltablespace, Relation pg_class, char relpersistence){\n\tswitch (relpersistence){\n            /* you are here */\n```\n\n## Feature:\nAllow including "lines before" and "lines after" into the sticky scroll, or a hack to "collapse braces" or something, although that is too language specific, unfortunately.', 'closed_by': None, 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238568/reactions', 'total_count': 3, '+1': 3, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238568/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None, 'state_reason': None}, {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238567', 'repository_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode', 'labels_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238567/labels{/name}', 'comments_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238567/comments', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/issues/238567/events', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/238567', 'id': 2806850843, 'node_id': 'I_kwDOAn8RLM6nTSUb', 'number': 238567, 'title': 'We were unable to automatically build your code. Please replace the call to the autobuild action with your custom build steps. We were unable to automatically build your code. 'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0}, 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': 'Type: <b>Bug</b>\n\n\nI have a language server that detects various links in the code and annotates them via `documentLink` API. The language server send roughly the following links (https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.18/specification/#documentLink):\n\n```\n{\n\t"range": { ... },\n\t"target": "https://www.google.com/search?q=c%2B%2B20",\n\t"tooltip": "https://www.google.com/search?q=c%2B%2B20"\n}\n```\n\nIn VSCode the tooltip is displayed correctly, however the actual link is transformed to `https://www.google.com/search?q=c++20` -- `%2B` is changed to `+`, which is then interpreted as a whitespace.\n\nI constructed a minimal repro with a `DocumentLinkProvider`:\n\n```typescript\nprovideDocumentLinks: (document, token) => {\n\tconst url = "https://www.google.com/search?q=c%2B%2B20";\n\tconst start = document.getText().indexOf(url);\n\tconst end = start + url.length;\n\tconst range = new vscode.Range(\n\t\tdocument.positionAt(start),\n\t\tdocument.positionAt(end),\n\t);\n\tconst link = new vscode.DocumentLink(range, vscode.Uri.parse(url));\n\tlink.tooltip = url;\n\treturn [link];\n}\n```\n\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/34cf7750-f424-46e8-879c-c0be9f85fcff)\n\nVS 0}, 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': "<!-- âš ï¸âš ï¸ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template âš ï¸âš ï¸ -->\n<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->\n<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->\n\n<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->\n## **Feature Request: Ability to Set a Specific Terminal as Active**\n\n### **Problem**\nCurrently, there is no public API in Visual Studio Code to directly set a specific terminal as active. The only way to change the active terminal is through user interaction (e.g., clicking on a terminal tab). This limitation makes it difficult to target specific terminals programmatically for various actions.\n\nIn some cases, such as clearing a terminal's contents or executing a command on a specific terminal, developers need to be able to set a particular terminal as the active one. However, since there is no way to explicitly set the active terminal, developers are forced to rely on indirect methods, such as showing the terminal with `terminal.show()`, which updates the `onDidChangeActiveTerminal` event but does not immediately update the internal reference to the active terminal.\n\n### **Use Case**\nAs an extension developer, I need the ability to:\n1. **Set a specific terminal as active** programmatically, without relying on user interaction.\n2. **Perform actions** (e.g., clear buffer (not sendText, so there is no issue using `clear` on windows cmd )) on a specific terminal without it being the last interacted one.\n\n### **Current Workaround**\nThe current workaround involves using the `terminal.show()` method, which updates the `onDidChangeActiveTerminal` event, but does not immediately update the `activeInstance` reference used internally. This can cause issues when performing actions such as clearing the terminal buffer using the `workbench.action.terminal.clear` command, which only works on the active terminal.\n\nFor example, while `terminal.show()` brings the terminal into focus, the `activeInstance` may not be updated in time, leading to unexpected behavior when attempting to clear or interact with a terminal programmatically.\n\n### **Proposed Solution**\nIt would be beneficial to introduce a method or functionality in the public API that allows developers to explicitly set a terminal as active. This would ensure that actions like clearing the buffer or sending text can be targeted at a specific terminal, regardless of whether itâ€™s the last interacted terminal.\n\n### **Why This Is Important**\nThis feature would:\n- Improve control over terminal interactions in extensions.\n- Allow developers to target and interact with specific terminals programmatically, avoiding reliance on user interaction or side effects.\n- Enhance the development experience by making terminal actions more predictable and reliable.\n\n### **Additional Notes**\nWhile this request is related to the inability to directly set a terminal as active, it also ties into cases such as clearing the terminal buffer. Without a way to explicitly set a terminal as active, itâ€™s challenging to ensure that actions like `workbench.action.terminal.clear` or other terminal commands are applied to the correct terminal instance.\n\n", 'closed_by': {'login': 'Tyriar', 'id': 2193314, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjIxOTMzMTQ=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/2193314?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': '2025-01-22T18:15:53Z', 'updated_at': '2025-01-22T19:01:05Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'sub_issues_summary': {'total': 0, 'completed': 0, 'percent_completed': 0}, 'active_lock_reason': None, 'draft': False, 'pull_request': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/vscode/pulls/238485', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/238485', 'diff_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/238485.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/238485.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': 'Provide a mechanism for extension to specify it\'s own default language.\r\nAllow extension owner to choose the language of untranslated string when using the builtin l10n API.\r\n\r\nFor motivation of this PR, please refer to #168127.\r\n\r\n## Proposed Solution\r\n\r\nWe check the default language specified by extension maintainer from `package.json`.\r\nAnd assume being `en` if not specified, for backward compatibility reason.\r\n\r\n### Library Logic\r\n\r\nWhen default-lang of extension match current VSCode language, we will not load any additional\r\nstring bundle. If default-lang is not matched, we will try loading `bundle.l10n.<locale>.json`\r\nbundle file for current VSCode language.\r\n\r\nThe rest logic remain untouched, e.g. how we bypass translation if there is no corresponding bundle.\r\n\r\n### Manifest Format in package.json\r\n\r\nAs proposed by TylerLeonhardt. In addition to original usage\r\n\r\n```json\r\n{\r\n    "l10n": "./l10n"\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nNow we support the format like\r\n\r\n```json\r\n{\r\n    "l10n": {\r\n        "location": "./l10n",\r\n        "defaultLocale": "en"\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nas a way to specify default-lang for extensions by their maintainers.\r\n\r\n## How to Verify\r\n\r\nIs\'s not so easy to verify the if logic is correct, since that all related logic are coupled with\r\na. vscode current language b. file system state of particular extension.\r\n\r\n### Prepare Extension\r\n\r\nWrite a extension that\r\n\r\n1. `vscode.l10n.t` to translate a string.\r\n2. specify l10n.defaultLocale other than `en`\r\n3. provide a translated string bundle in English: `bundle.l10n.en.json`\r\n\r\nPackage the extension for following steps.\r\n\r\n(I prepare a sample extension at https://github.com/wdhongtw/try-plugin, where the default-lang is `ja` Japanese.)\r\n\r\n### Verify VSCode Logic\r\n\r\nNow we need to launch a VSCode instance for three setup.\r\n\r\nA. VSCode language match extension default-lang.\r\nTry load the extension and verify the original string in `vscode.l10n.t` function call is used.\r\n\r\nB. VSCode language does not match extension default-lang and be in any language that the extension\r\ndo provide translated string bundle.\r\nTry load the extension and verify the translated string in `bundle.l10n.<locale>.json` is used.\r\n\r\nC. VSCode language does not match extension default-lang and be in any language that extension\r\ndoes not provide translated string bundle.\r\nTry load the extension and verify the original string in `vscode.l10n.t` function call is used.\r\n\r\n(To change the language of VSCode quickly, we can patch `defaultNLSConfiguration` in `src\\vs\\base\\node\\nls.ts`)', 'closed_by': None, 'reactions': need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The \'Help > Report Issue\' dialog can assist with this. -->\n\n### Summary of the issue\n\nWhen a user clicks "Apply in Editor", it is hard for the user to follow the process. There is no clear indication of when the update starts or when it finishes. The only way a user can tell the update is complete is when my cursor moves to the top of the code editor. It would be very helpful to have an audio notification or some other indicator to signal when the update begins and when it is done. A similar indicator to what is implemented in the chat would work well here.\n\n### Issue source\n- Community Discussion\n- Reported: December 20, 2024 by snufas \n- Discussion Number: #147602\n- Discussion Link: https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/147602\n\n### What is the name of the user?\nsnufas\n\n### What does the user need?\nA clear indicator of when the update stops and/or finishes - an audio notification has been suggested \n\n### Is this issue related to accessibility, usability, or is it a feature request?\nAccessibility \n\n### Repo information\nOur GitHub tester installed Copilot Chat on their VScode, and made sure they had accessibility signals set to `on` or `auto` in their VSCode settings for:\n\n- Chat Request Sent\n- Chat Response received\n- Code Action Applied\n- Code Action Triggered\n- Tasks completed\n\nThey confirmed that when they selected `Apply in Editor` from Copilot chat, there was no sound signal. Below is a video with NVDA in a Windows VM.\n\nWhen the Copilot suggestions are fully loaded into the chat, there is a sound signal to indicate the chat has completed. However there is no sound signal after applying a suggestion with `Apply in Editor`:\n\nhttps://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f5d902e1-235d-424f-81b1-e2b8b7061d3b\n\n### Additional When I define my settings.json like this, Prettier IS the formatter used for formatting json files:\n```\n  "editor.formatOnSave": true,\n  "[typescriptreact]": {\n    "editor.defaultFormatter": "esbenp.prettier-vscode"\n  },\n  "[json]": {\n    "editor.defaultFormatter": "esbenp.prettier-vscode"\n  },\n  "editor.defaultFormatter": "esbenp.prettier-vscode",\n```\n\nThe only difference between the two settings.json snippets is that in the first, the language-specific instructions are combined into one line (as introduced in issue [51935](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/51935), and documented https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/settings#_multiple-languagespecific-editor-settings), while in the second they are defined as separate blocks.\n\nAs far as I understand, the behavior between the two should be exactly the same.\n\nI have tried both `"[json][typescriptreact]"` and `"[typescriptreact][json]"`, but in neither case will Prettier be the active formatter in JSON files.
